results.title: The Destruction of St. Patrick's College 1971
results.brief_description: The old St Patrick’s College was demolished to make way for an ecclesiastic office building. Professor Hartley Gratten, of the University of Texas considers, against the background of the demolition by Whelan the Wrecker, why Australians ignore their national heritage.
results.description: The old St Patrick’s College was demolished to make way for an ecclesiastic office building. Professor Hartley Gratten, of the University of Texas considers, against the background of the demolition by Whelan the Wrecker, why Australians ignore their national heritage.

results.title: Coma
results.creator_credit: Ray Argall, St John Ambulance Australia and British Petroleum
results.brief_description:
Coma can be caused by epilspsy, drowning, drug overdose or head injuries. Shows what to do for people in a deep coma. The victim should be moved into the approved coma position until medical help arrives. It is the only treatment that a first aider can and should apply.

PLEASE NOTE: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date first-aid practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: The Cave: a parable told by Orson Welles
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow and Counterpoint Films
results.brief_description: An animated dramatization based on “The Allegory of the Cave” from Book 7 of Plato’s “Republic” illustrating mankind’s escape from the world of illusion to the world of reality. Four men chained in a cave take images reflected on a wall for the truth. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: Australian gazette. No. 363
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Adelaide dog show; Bronzetti wins the Caulfield Cup against Chrome and Rael Loein; Rocket wins the Sydney Flying Squadron’s handicap in the opening event of the sailing season on Sydney Harbour and 85 unions are represented at the annual eight hour day demonstrations.

results.title: As long as I can walk
results.brief_description: A report on a Moratorium March held in Melbourne in 1970. Interviews with marchers give insights into personal motives, and show the strong desire for a peaceful settlement of the Vietnam question.
results.description: A report on a Moratorium March held in Melbourne in 1970. Interviews with marchers give insights into personal motives, and show the strong desire for a peaceful settlement of the Vietnam question.

results.title: Alpine Playground
results.creator_credit: Tourist Development Authority of Victoria and Cinesound
results.brief_description: A holiday with a difference; the joys of an alpine winter holiday in Victoria’s picturesque skiing resorts, Mt Buffalo, Mt Hotham and Falls Creek. Within easy reach of Melbourne, facilities include expert ski instruction, readily available ski tows, toboggans, and comfortable accommodation.

results.title: Fifty Years of Service
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and State Electricity Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: The first fifty years of the State Electricity Commission is presented by means of archival film detailing highlights of the development of the power authority for Victoria - from 1919 to the completion of the giant Hazelwood power complex.

results.title: [Big Melbourne]
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Malcolm Wallhead
results.brief_description: Possible State Film Centre production. Shows a woman and her son on a journey through Melbourne’s central business district, including Flinders Street train station, St Paul’s Cathedral, shopping at Myer. Also features footage of ships and boats.

results.title: Beneath our feet. Parts 1-3
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: The Scenery of Victoria looks at the landforms throughout the state and relates the actual location to its geological significance. “Geological history of Victoria” Very similar to Part 1, but made for year 10 science with more emphasis on the period of history each geological type fits into. “Granite” looks at the formation and coding processes that produce granite with emphasis on the seven types of rocks that are currently associated with granite.

results.title: Lily
results.creator_credit: Julie Money, Women's Film Unit and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A dramatic discussion starter which confronts the social issue of racial prejudice shown through the eyes of a young Asian Australian woman, Lily. The film has the advantage of being both open-ended and humourous, allowing students to identify with the characters within the film and working as a stimulus to class discussion.
